question: You successfully passed a job interview. You are expected to start on November 15, but you will not be available on that date. Task: Write a letter to your new boss, explaining your situation, expressing your concern and suggesting a solution
text: I am John Kane, I have been recently shortlisted as React Js Developer in your company (XYZ). As we discussed in an interview process that I would join your firm on 15th November. I am writing this mail to inform you that unfortunately, I would not be able to present on that date.

As I informed you during my interview process that I have 15 days of the employment notice period in my current company so that I can complete my pending tasks and hand over to my colleagues and seniors. But I got sick for a few days, Therefore, I was not able to finish the tasks. I was on bed rest during this time. If you want, then I can forward my medical reports and tests.

To clear my backlogs created with my late start, I can ensure that I will work for at least two extra hours each day. I feel responsible for the pressure created in the company due to my late start. So, I will work harder until everything gets normal.
I sincerely apologize for this inconvenience and hope for a good start in the future.  If you need any medical proof or letter, then please let me know.

error_list.error_des: It seems that there is a pronoun problem here.
